title: Icefields
author: Thomas Wharton
description: Icefields is a fascinating novel set in the icy wilderness of Canada. The story explores themes of survival, nature, and human perseverance.

reviews.name: Abrham
reviews.review: The book was a great insider into humans. I saw more of them than the infamous icefields. The way the story was laid out went back and forth from different characters webbing a story line that would only converge and make sense as the further you read on. The little dialogues were lovely(Although the characters didn't say much). I would urge anyone with the slightest desire to read the book to go through with it.

reviews.name: Dawit
reviews.review: A contemplative note, leaving readers to ponder the complexities of the human experience in relation to the natural world. It's a richly layered novel that combines adventure with philosophical inquiry. The vivid setting and complex characters give a deep exploration into the themes of ambition, nature, and the human condition.The book challenges each of us to assess the cost of our ambition against the deep beauty and powerful splendor of nature.
